channel.title: [Help]Upload Form[Help]
channel.description:
Does anyone know whats wrong with this?

Upload files

Upload files to your selected folder
Whats in the completion.js:
function disp_alert() { alert("Upload Successful!") }

Exactly how much ASP, HTML, and JS do you know?

item.title: [Help]Upload Form[Help]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“3.65 kilos, post:3, topic:142464”]First of all, you forgot …

And to get your alert to work, just put what you have in completion.js somewhere in the top (excluding the button of course), then on the upload button, have it be Upload

And what is your uploadaction() function? It’s not in the code you provided.[/quote]

Yeah, that, unfortunately idk how to make that one peice of code, i forgot, learned it 2 months back =.

[quote=“3.65 kilos, post:5, topic:142464”]Er…I just got rid of the action attribute in form tag…

(and that doesn’t show the alert when you click the button)[/quote]

Once you uploaded the file successfully, it will present you with that message.

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:2, topic:142464”]Exactly why do you believe there is something wrong with it?

You don’t get the alert? You don’t have an uploaded file?[/quote]

Because i go to the page, and theres an error at the bottom? And i don’t know how to make the upload function…

I think it goes something like this?

function uploadAction() { //Don't know what to write here? Making it upload to the ASP page, which is my database. }

Read full topic

item.title: [Help]Upload Form[Help]

item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

And <form … action=“completion.js” should be <form … action=“disp_alert();”
Right?

item.title: [Help]Upload Form[Help]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Does anyone know whats wrong with this?

<script type="text/javascript">
    tp1 = new WebFXTabPane(document.getElementById("tabPane1"));

</script>

<div id="tabPage1" class="tab-page-s">
    <h2 class="tab">Upload files</h2>

    <script type="text/javascript">
        tp1.addTabPage(document.getElementById("tabPage1"));
    </script>

    <form name="uploadForm" action="completion.js" method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data" target="uploadframe">
        
        <input type="hidden" name="mainDC" value="1" />
Upload files to your selected folder 
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="1" width="278">
    <tbody id="fileTBODY" >
        <tr id="fileTR">
            <td width="260">
                <input type="file" id="fid0" name="fff0" size="34" style="width:255px" onChange="">
            </td>
            <td align="center">
            </td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>
Upload

Whats in the completion.js:

function disp_alert() { alert("Upload Successful!") }

Read full topic
